t: Prayer for Godâ€™s Mercy upon the Nation.
For the choir director. A Psalm of the sons of Korah.
O*pn Lord,*s You showed favor to Your land; You*ln restored the captivity of Jacob.
You*ln forgave the iniquity of Your people; You*ln covered all their sin. Selah.
You*ln withdrew all Your fury; You*ln turned away from Your burning anger.
Restore*ln us, O God of our salvation, And*ln cause Your indignation toward us to cease.
Will*ln You be angry with us forever? Will*ln You prolong Your anger to all generations?
Will*ln You not Yourself revive us again, That*ln Your people may rejoice in You?
Show*ln us Your lovingkindness, O Lord,*s And*ln grant us Your salvation.
I*ln will hear what God the Lord*s will say; For*ln He will speak peace to His people, to His godly ones; But*ln let them not turn back to folly.
Surely*ln His salvation is near to those who fear Him, That*ln glory may dwell in our land.
Lovingkindness*ln and truth have met together; Righteousness*ln and peace have kissed each other.
Truth*ln springs from the earth, And*ln righteousness looks down from heaven.
Indeed,*ln the Lord*s will give what is good, And*ln our land will yield its produce.
Righteousness*ln will go before Him And*ln will make His footsteps into a way.
